dialogues.DEADPOOL:
[1]Written by 
[2]Kinda lonesome back here. 
[3]Little help? 
[4]Pool. Deadpool. 
[5]It's like Christmas Day, Dopinder. Been waiting one thousand eight hundred twenty- two days, three hours... ...and thirty-six minutes for this shit. 
[6]Nice. 
[7]Not the Daffodil Daydream.      The girl. 
[8]Dopinder, I'm starting to think I'm in this cab for a reason. 
[9]No, my slender brown friend... to give you one crucial piece of advice: Love... is a beautiful thing. When it finds you, the whole world smells like Daffodil Daydream. Deadpool    Final Shooting Script   11/16/15 
[10]So hold onto love tight. Go at Bandhu hard. Get Gita back. Or else... the whole world will taste like Mama June after hot yoga. 
[11]Like two hobos making love under a drizzle of Limburger- I could go all day like this. Point is, bad. 
[12]Shiiiit. My extra mags! I usually leave them right by the door so I'll trip over them! Someone must've moved them... 
[13]No time. Not today. Ten, eleven, twelve... or bust. Right here! 
[14]Oooo. I never carry a wallet when I'm working. Ruins the lines of my suit. How 'bout a crisp high five? 
[15]I owe you one. Merry Christmas, Dopinder. 
[16]Can I get some fries with that shake- shake boobie? If looks could kill you would be an uzi. 
[17]Oh, hello, Deadpool here. You may be wondering whose balls I had to fondle to get my own movie. Rhymes with `Polverine.' Couple'a smooth criminals. In a word, gorgeous. Surprisingly little hair down there. It's a jungle down there. Thick underbrush. Anyway, I smell Oscar. The suit's gonna match the carpet. Now... places to be... faces to fix... bad guys to kill... 
[18]On your mark, get set, go, let me go, let me shoop... 
[19]¡Hola! ¡Me llamo Piscina De La Muerte! Hello! My name is the Pool of Death. There's no easy way to say this. I'm pregnant, Trevor. Any of you seen Green Lantern? Me neither. 
[20]Rich... Corinthian... Leather. 
[21]Scuse, por favor! 
[22]Ow.   Ow.   Ow. Ow. Ow. 
[23]Loved your work in Daredevil. 
[24]Shit.   Did I leave the stove on? 
[25]Wait, wait... 
[26]Wait! You're probably wondering. Why the red suit? It's so bad guys can't see me bleed. This guy has the idea. He wore the brown pants. All together now... 
[27]Twelve..! 
[28]Eleven... 
[29]Ten... 
[30]Nine.    Shit! Eight. Fuck! Seven.       Shit- fuck! 
[31]Six. 
[32]Someone's not counting.    Cinco. 
[33]Me gusta cinco. 
[34]Four.   Three. Stupid. Worth it. 
[35]Number two... 
[36]What the shit-biscuit! Where you at, Francis? 
[37]One. 
[38]I'm touching myself tonight. 
[39]Really?     Rolling up the sleeves? 
[40]I know what you're thinking... 
[41]I'll bet he works out. So what if I am pulling the double shift at the ab- factory? What if I do want my man menu to feature the shredded beef? Call it insecurity. But I haven't touched a carb since... 
[42]Here's the thing. Life is an endless series of train-wrecks with only brief, commercial-like breaks of happiness. This had been the ultimate commercial break. Which meant it was time to return... 
[43]...to our regularly scheduled program. 
[44]See, people do react differently. Vanessa's already working on Plan A. B. All the way to Z. Me? I'm memorizing the details of her face. Like it's the first time I'm seeing it. Or the last. 
[45]Believe it or not, this is only the ninth shittiest thing that's ever happened to me. 
[46]Stick around. Number 6 is coming right up. 
[47]You know how many people I've killed to find you? 
[48]So you're aware I've been waiting a long, long time for this. And now I'm finally gonna... So you're aware of the category 5 fuck- storm that's coming. Then you know what's coming. I'm about to do to you what Sugar Ray did to the mid-nineties. 
[49]Dad? 
[50]Thank you, Agent Smith. 
[51]Some kind of anger can't be managed. Like the kind where your year-long plan ends with the wrong guy getting dismembered! That said... when it comes time to licking wounds... there's no place like home, and I share that home with someone you met, the old blind lady from the laundromat, Al. She's like Robin to my Batman. Except she's old. And black. And blind. 
[52]And I think she loves me. Wait... pretty sure Robin loves Batman, too. 
[53]Then, just when I thought I could breathe easy... 
[54]If you think I'm losing my marbles `cause I can't breathe. You're only half right. 
[55]See, if Francis was able to see his reflection... 
[56]You know what they say. You always remember your first time. 
[57]Even 5 years later... 
[58]There... all caught up. 
[59]Thanks for the lift! Apologies if I bled in the recyclables. 
[60]Let's get ready to Rooooooomba! 
[61]Morning, roomie! This place reeks like old lady pants. 
[62]But you're no lady. 
[63]So comfy. 
[64]You mean my big rubber masturbatin' shoes? 
[65]One-thousand eight-hundred twenty-two ornaments pinned to two-hundred-sixty calendars. All for a `Christmas' that... never... came! 
[66]Sit on a stick. 
[67]Yeah. Bactine should do it. How's the Kullen coming? IKEA doesn't assemble itself. 
[68]Anything's an improvement on the Hurdal. I'd have taken a Hemnes... or even a Trysil... over the Hurdal. But I didn't get excited `til I saw the Kullen. 
[69]Here? Now? Just kidding.          I know it's been decades for you. 
[70]And totally grossed out! 
[71]And I quote: `Looking for roommate. Blind to life's imperfections. Must be good with hands.' Or wouldya rather I build IKEA and you pay rent? 
[72]Let's recap. That cock-thistle who turned me into this freak... the one I've been waiting five years for... slipped through my arms today. Arm. 
[73]Catching him was my only chance to be hot again. Get my super-sexy ex back. And stop the same shit from happening to anyone else. So yeah, things are pretty fucking scrumptious. 
[74]Hash-tag Drive-by. 
[75]Once I've got the cure, I'm gonna do the same to Francis... 
[76]Sorry, Francis. But my lips are sealed. 
[77]I didn't just get the cure to El Cáncer. I got the cure to everything. 
[78]In the whole wide world, there's nothing as ugly... ...as fear. 
[79]Don't make me ask twice.     Where's Francis?! 
[80]I said, where's... fucking... FR- You made me ask twice. 
[81]Fuck.   Me. 
[82]Don't make me ask twice.      Where's- 
[83]Donde esta Francisco? 
[84]And I don't have time for you to learn. 
[85]Take me to your leader. I've always wanted to say that. 
[86]Squeal.     Like a pig. Where's Francis? 
[87]In no particular order. Where's your boss? And where can I find good Indian food? 
[88]That's so bad guys can't- never mind, they've already heard that. 
[89]You're about to tell me everything you know about Francis Freeman. Known aliases. Current whereabouts. Boxers or briefs. Go. 
[90]Open your mouth. Here comes the airplane! 
[91]
[92]Don't make me break out the Collective Soul CDs. 
[93]You give me your boss.     I give you the rest of your life. 
[94]I don't feel good about myself.     But where is he? I'm so sorry. 
[95]Agent Smith! 
[96]I know, right?! I look like a million bucks. 
[97]Literally - this suit cost Fox a million dollars. 
[98]Come out, come out, wherever you are! Don't make me ask tw- Good for you! 
[99]Don't recognize the voice? Maybe the resumé: Forty-one confirmed kills. Make that Eighty-nine. Seven the past week alone. Same rate most folks... ...get a shave. 
[100]Ding-ding-ding! Now... you're about to tell me where I can find your boss. Or I'm gonna make you feel worse. Wait... 
[101]...worse than worse. 
[102]Santa Claus is coming... 
[103]...to town! 
[104]Late-late-late-late-late! 
[105]Hurry-hurry-hurry-hurry-hurry! 
[106]Taxi! 
[107]And we all know how this turned out. Cue Benny Hill speed... 
[108]There. All caught up. 
[109]You can stick that where you stuck the Bactine! I found my stash of wisdom- tooth Percocet in the Storjorm, and I'm orbiting Saturn. But I appreciate the gesture. 
[110]The size of a KFC spork. 
[111]What do I keep saying, Mrs. Magoo? She wouldn't have me! If you could see me, you'd understand. 
[112]No, you're blind. 
[113]A clue why our Ivar shelving unit's about to fall the fuck apart. 
[114]Just clocking time `til this arm plows through puberty. I've got a new Christmas Day. 
[115]Now, ya may want to leave the room. I bet it feels huge in this hand. 
[116]I'm about to lose what's left of my shit. Is there a word for half-afraid, half- furious? 
[117]Fuck. 
[118]We gotta find her fast.    Before fuck-ass. 
[119]I come for the French Onion Soup. How do you think? I'm constantly stalking that fox. 
[120]Every time I see her is like the first time. 
[121]Even from this angle. Especially from this angle. 
[122]Shittiest moment numero tres. 
[123]Lezzdothis. Before I re-reconsider. Maximum effort. 
[124]Sorry. I get very uncomfortable around you guys. Crisp high five? 
[125]Mother-fucker best be wearing his brown pants. 
[126]And... numero dos. 
[127]Ripley from `Alien 3'! 
[128]It's like you knew I was about to knock! Is that big steel dildo home? 
[129]Like there's something wrong with eating before sundown. Or saving money. But no. It's about me saving my girl from a bad guy, the one you two helped me lose. You do fight bad guys? No time for hard stares, are you gonna fetch big-shiny-balls or not? Tell him I have an offer he can't refuse! 
[130]Yep, that's me, seeing the error of my ways! I just need an itty bitty favor in return! Fool him five times? Shame on him. 
[131]And we've all seen what I can do with twelve. 
[132]Careful, Ronnie Milsap, we're down-range! And we decided on the Orrberg, not the Borgsjo. 
[133]The coolest. Plus, she could never pick you out of a line-up. 
[134]It's Francis. He wants me to come to him. And he calls me a piece of- 
[135]Uh-uh-uh. 
[136]Please. It's been years since you've hit anything. See what I did there? 
[137]In case I never see you again, I love you very much... and there's a hundred-ten million dollars buried somewhere in the apartment. Good luck. Watch your face. 
[138]Any luck winning Gita back? 
[139]It's all relative. 
[140]Oh, please. I'll bet the halls of your high school were very well monitored. 
[141]You mean ESP. But come on!      I coulda- 
[142]Gaaaahhhh! 
[143]Twinkly, but deadly. My big Russki friend doesn't like the idea of a whole new army of mutant mutton-heads. And I told him if he did me this solid, I'd consider joining his boy band. 
[144]Sure it's not. 
[145]Uh.   Dopinder. What was that? 
[146]Something must've gotten lost in the translation. 
[147]Seriously. This is no way to win Gita's heart. Return Bandhu home safe and gentle-like. And then woo Gita with your boyish charm... 
[148]For you?    Ten. 
[149]Time to make the chimichangas. 
[150]Not often a dude ruins your face. Destroys your living. Grabs your future baby mama. Personally sees to 8 of your 10 shittiest life moments. And plans to lather-rinse-repeat on a buncha new chumps. Let's just say, it's beginning to look a lot like Christmas... 
[151]It happens. A'ight, cue up DMX again. 
[152]Gahhhhhhh! 
[153]Goddamnit! Never mind. Nothing that can't be fixed by two swords and... ...maximum effort. Gimme a beat! 
[154]Long term, that's hard on your knees. Super-hero landing! Clearly you're far too much dude for me. Which is why... ...I brought him. 
[155]I also brought her. 
[156]I feel sorry for the guy who tries to pressure her into prom sex. 
[157]Finish fucking her the fuck up. 
[158]Hey, fellas, whoa! Hold on!        Don'tcha wanna hear my terms?! 
[159]You guys only work for that shit-spackled Muppet fart! So I'm gonna give y'all the chance to lay down your firearms in return for preferential - bordering on gentle - possibly even lover-like treatment. 
[160]Fine. Commando. Stay down, kid. Unless your power's stopping bullets. 
[161]Tea-bag! Bob?! 
[162]It's been since... Jacksonville! 
[163]Liked the Loaded Potato Skins.     Didn't like you. 
[164]Bob, y'mind taking a half-step right? No, your right. Never mind- 
[165]Yoo-hoo! 
[166]Light the candle... 
[167]Your plan to trip me to death?      Has failed. 
[168]You were right, babe. Red is my color. 
[169]You never left. 
[170]I hope they blocked pain to your every last nerve. `Cause I'm'a go looking. 
[171]Good one. 
[172]Let's dance. And by dance I mean try to kill each other. 
[173]Yowww! 
[174]Sounds like your last Saturday night. The sense of humor survived. 
[175]Since you can't feel it? I just knocked out your tooth. 
[176]We have so much to catch up on. 
[177]I'm good. 
[178]¡Caramba! For heaven's sake! 
[179]Wham!   Wham! Wham! 
[180]There are no words. 
[181]Me and you are headed to fix this face. Or else... 
[182]Um.    What? 
[183]You mean to say, after five long years, I've been chasing the wrong monkey? 
[184]Like the kind of stupid who admits he can't do the one thing I'm keeping him alive for? Any last words? Good. I got one: Francis. 
[185]I'm sorry? 
[186]To...? 
[187]You were droning on! I may be stuck looking like pepperoni flatbread, but at least we've heard the last of him. If wearing super-hero tights means sparing psychopaths, maybe I wasn't meant to wear `em. Not everyone monitors a hall like you. 
[188]I'll be on the lookout for the next four moments. 
[189]
[190]Anyone else turned on? That's what I love about y- 
[191]I totally deserved that! That too! Maybe not the nethers. 
[192]I'm so sorry. For leaving. And taking so long to cowboy up. It's been a rough few years. 
[193]I live in a crack house. With a family of twelve. At night, we spoon for warmth. Everyone fights for Noelle. She's the fattest. Deadpool   Final Shooting Script   11/16/15 
[194]There's nothing we don't share.    Floor space. Dental floss. Condoms. 
[195]I woulda found you before now. But the guy behind this mask isn't the same guy you remember. 
[196]And this one. In case the other fell off. 
[197]Oo. Ah.    Quicker - like a Bandaid!    Owww- di 5000. 
[198]Sure? 
[199]I understand. Deadpool   Final Shooting Script     11/16/15 
[200]You already did. Twice. Seriously? 
[201]I'm also not the same under these pants. Super-penis. 
[202]Gah! What the hell are you two still doing here?! You, go clean some chalk-board erasers, or be a... really Big Brother, or teach fat kids to eat lettuce. And you, Chicken Noodle. Well... I feel something stupid coming on. Gaaaaaaahhhhhh! Deadpool    Final Shooting Script   11/16/15 
[203]I am?! Omigod. That. Was. Not. Mean! Seriously, guys, it was a pleasure. For a second there, we felt like... like... ...five mini lion robots forming a large super robot. 
[204]Now, I meant it, both of you, fire up the Blackbird and shoo! Scram! Vamoose! Skedaddle! Don't make me keep thinking of these! 
[205]Where were we, darlin'? Oh, riiight. The best part. 
[206]`Wham!'    As promised. 
[207]See, life can smell like Daffodil Daydream. So if you're sitting out there in your own personal Punch-Bowl. Ms. Mama June on your tongue. Find someone to hold... and someone to hold on to you. Life's next little train wreck... 
[208]..will be so much easier if you do. 
[209]Which brings us to shittiest moment number 1! The guy behind the guy, Dr. Killebrew, off scot-free. 
[210]But let's look on the bright side. You smell what I smell? I mean besides stale popcorn and my post-fight man-funk? 
[211]Sequel. Maybe even one of those ensemble team movies... 
[212]So, `til next time, this is your friendly neighborhood pool guy saying... I'm never gonna dance again... the way I danced with you. 
[213]You're still here? It's over! Go home. Wait... you expected a tease for Deadpool 2?! Sorry, we're low on dough. But if you can keep a secret, I can tell you who's gonna be in it. Cable! Someone suggested Mel Gibson for the role, buuuut- I was thinking Liam Neeson. Only problem, Liam likes to get paid. And more for Liam means less for me. Maybe we'll crowdfund the shit. Just you and me, kids. Shalom! 
[214]You're still here? It's over! Go home. Wait... you expected a tease for Deadpool 2?! Maybe a little Samuel L. Jackson? Sorry, that budget went to Weasel's Ketamine habit. But if you can keep a secret, I can tell you who's gonna be in it. Cable! You're allowed to show your pleasure. I'd love Liam Neeson for the role, but Liam likes to get paid. And more for Liam means less for me. So we'd best crowdfund the shit. Depending on your level of giving, you could receive a Colossus-brand desktop steel-ball clacker, a Dwayne `The Rock' Johnson real doll, or four minutes alone in a room with Charlie Sheen.   Donate now! And shalom!
dialogues.WADE:
[1]I did. 
[2]Pineapple and olive? 
[3]Sweet and salty. 
[4]Burnt crust? 
[5]Relax, son, that's hows I likes it!      Once you go black, you never go back! 
[6]Thanks! 
[7]Jeremy, is it? 
[8]Wade Wilson. Jeremy, that's a no go on the tiperoo. I'm not here for him. I'm here for you. 
[9]Not out of the woods yet. You need to seriously ease up on the bedazzling. They're jeans, not a chandelier. And the Axe body spray. 
[10]PS, I'm keeping your wallet.         Ya did kinda give it to me... 
[11]I will shoot your fucking cat. 
[12]Then whose kitty-litter did I just shit in? Anyhoo, you by chance know a Meghan Orlovsky? Getting that right? Orlovsky? Orloskvy? Do you? 
[13]Good.   `Cause she knows you. 
[14]What situation isn't improved by pizza? 
[15]Jeremy, I belong to a group of guys who take a dime to beat a fella down. Little Meghan's not made of money, but lucky her, I've got a soft spot. 
[16]A stalker. Threats hurt, Jer. Though not nearly as bad as serrated steel. 
[17]So keep away from Meghan.       We cool? 
[18]Then we're done. 
[19]Soft spot, remember? But even look in her general direction again? You'll learn in the worst of ways. I've got some hard spots too. That came out wrong. Or did it? 
[20]"Oooo, oooo, oooo!" 
[21]You've seen the last of Jeremy. 
[22]That's why we do it. 
[23]What'd he do to you? 
[24]Good for him! Sorry, ladies. Me no dig cigs. And I may look mean. But if I give a guy a pavement facial? He earned it. 
[25]That I ain't. 
[26]Boothe! Deadpool   Final Shooting Script   11/16/15 
[27]I'd love a blow-job. 
[28]The drink, moose-knuckle.     But first... 
[29]I ain't taking allowance money. Make sure it gets back to Ms. Osflorsky? Onroflensky? Olly-Olly-Oxen-Free? 
[30]He's not a bad kid, Weas. Just a little light stalking. I was way worse at his age- traveling to far-off places - Baghdad, Mogadishu, Jacksonville - - meeting new and exciting people - 
[31]Classified. They have a wonderful TGIFridays. Those guys know their way around a Loaded Potato Skin. The point is, I'm trying to put those days in my rear-view. 
[32]Kelly, you mind taking this over to Buck? Tell him it's from Boothe. Little foreplay. 
[33]I don't take the shits.       I just disturb them. 
[34]It's a dirty job... but someone's gotta take out the garbage. 
[35]Lemme guess. Ya got Boothe in Sister Margaret's dead pool. 
[36]You did not bet on me to die. You bet on me to die. 
[37]Weasel, you're the world's worst friend. Joke's on you. I'm living to 102. Like those old Quaker biddies on the Today Show. And retiring on my winnings. 
[38]The Biebs. But I'm probably wrong. Nothing bad ever happens to teen stars who make 80 mil a year and think they're immune to the pitfalls of addiction and consequence. He'll be fine. Drinks on me, soldiers of fortune! 
[39]Tight. 
[40]What's a nice place like you doing in a girl like this? 
[41]Buck, you'd best apologize, before- 
[42]Yeah, that. 
[43]OK, he apologized... hakuna his tatas... 
[44]Merchandise? So, what, you, uh, bump fuzzies for money? 
[45]Rough childhood? 
[46]Daddy left before I was conceived. 
[47]I didn't know there was any other place to put one out. 
[48]Me too.     Uncle. 
[49]I watched my own birthday party from the keyhole of a locked closet, which was also my- 
[50]So you had a dishwasher. I didn't know sleep. It was pretty much 24-7 of ball gags, brownie mix, and fun-house mirrors. 
[51]Hopefully you. Later tonight. And my Uncle Kevin. 
[52]What can I get for two-hundred-seventy three bucks... and a Yogurtland rewards card? 
[53]Time to put balls... in holes. 
[54]You said whatever I want. 
[55]Tough call. Just trying to get to know the real you... not the plunging- necklined, short-shorted, two-dimensional sex object peddled by Hollywood. 
[56]Prepare to lose tragically. 
[57]The limited edition Voltron: Defender of the Universe ring, por favor. 
[58]Then I guess the tire-grade rubber Voltron keychain. 
[59]M'lady? 
[60]Arus. And you're more evil than evil King Zarkon himself. 
[61]How many more minutes for this? FYI. Five mini lion-bots come together to make up the super-bot. 
[62]That's all I'll need! 
[63]What do we do with the remaining two minutes thirty seven seconds? 
[64]All year? 
[65]Happy Chinese New Year's... 
[66]Happy Fourth of July! 
[67]Happy Halloween... 
[68]Sorry. Happy Halloween... 
[69]If your left leg is Thanksgiving, and your right leg is Christmas... 
[70]...can I visit you between the holidays? 
[71]Holy fucking shit. 
[72]Y'know, I've been doing some thinking... 
[73]...about why we're so good together. 
[74]Your crazy    matches my crazy. We're like two jigsaw    pieces... weird curvy edges... but fit us    together, you can see the picture on    top. 
[75]They say one month's salary. 
[76]Slow month. I've been waiting for this day like Boss Hogg waits to get to the crazy cheesy crust... 
[77]I do. 
[78]Thought you charged extra for that. 
[79]So that's a-? 
[80]What if I never let go? 
[81]`Star Wars' jokes?! 
[82]It's like I made you in a computer. 
[83]Cheese, say! 
[84]Perfect. 
[85]Wee break. 
[86]Shake it like a- Uh. You get it. 
[87]You're clowning.     You're not clowning?        I sense clowns. 
[88]This is my most prized possession. 
[89]Wham! `Make it Big' was the album George and Andy earned their exclamation point. 
[90]But this. A little piece of me died the day this came out... 
[91]Think of it as a spring cleaning. Only if spring was death. 
[92]Right! The tumors are only in my liver, lungs, prostate, and brain. All the things you can live without. 
[93]Babe, we've been through this! Cancer's a real shit-show. A Yakov-Smirnoff- opening-for-the-Spin-Doctors-at-the-Iowa- State-Fair shit-show. And under no circumstances will I take you to that show. I want you to remember me me. 
[94]I swear, I'll find you in the next life. And boom-box `Careless Whisper' under your window. Wham! 
[95]Super fucking bad-ass. 
[96]I just realized! I win! My life's officially more fucked-up than yours. 
[97]Nothing.    Everything. 
[98]Sorry. Liam Neeson nightmare. I kidnapped his daughter, and he just wasn't having it. 
[99]They've made three of those movies. At some point you wonder if he's just a bad parent. 
[100]Three shots of Patron Silver, Weez.     And a cure to terminal cancer. 
[101]You're starting to sound like Vanessa... 
[102]She sent away for all these colorful clinic brochures. I hear Chechnya's nice this time of... never. Then there's China... Central Mexico... Know how they say `Cancer' in Spanish? ¡El Cáncer.' 
[103]Forget your scythe? 
[104]Stalker alert. 
[105]One every seven weeks.     Same rate most folks get a hair-cut. 
[106]To wash the taste out. It's hard to forget being so... impressive. 
[107]People change. 
[108]I'd say you sound like an infomercial. And not a good infomercial, like Slap Chop. More Shake-Weighty. 
[109]I already tried the hero business. Let's just say it left a mark. The only chance you'll see me again is if I hit `fuck- it.' 
[110]For now, I'll get through this with the one I love. Deadpool     Final Shooting Script   11/16/15 
[111]De donde eres? 
[112]Ah.   The fancy part of Mexico. 
[113]Cancer?     Sorry - ¿El Cáncer? 
[114]Toughest part of the Tour de France. 
[115]Final stop on Desperation World Tour, 2016, which I believe was also the name of the Stones' last concert... 
[116]Hey! 
[117]It's on me. 
[118]Good luck to you, Pops. 
[119]Already here, hombre. 
[120]Long enough... 
[121]Worse.  Just promise you'll do right by me. So I can do right by someone else. 
[122]Oh, and please don't make my super suit green. Or animated. 
[123]Um.  My first request?    A warmer table. And warmer hands. 
[124]Easy!   Aren't you a little strong for a lady?   I'm calling wang. 
[125]It doesn't look like a hospital. It looks like Chlamydia holding still. 
[126]Oral fixation? 
[127]Can I expect turndown serv-? 
[128]Something in your teeth. 
[129]We'll see! 
[130]Puppies. 
[131]I swing both ways. 
[132]But me, I've been making a list of things I still plan to do. 
[133]I prefer fuck-it list: Naked tandem base- jumping with the WNBA's Sacramento Monarchs... Sparking up a spliff with the Olympic torch... 
[134]Giving Meredith Baxter Birney a dutch oven... 
[135]Don't take that shit, Cunningham! How tough can he be? Name like Francis. 
[136]That's right! He got `Ajax' off a dish- washing liquid! Legal name's Francis. F-R-A-N-C-I-oops. 
[137]Dry-cleaning tag, Francis.     Snagged it off your lab coat. Deadpool   Final Shooting Script   11/16/15 
[138]FYI. I may be able to get you the super- hero discount. 
[139]Uh, I wouldn't do that. Here's the problem with round-the-clock torture. You can't really step it up from there. 
[140]Yeah.   Francis.    That's what I think. 
[141]Um.   What? 
[142]And I thought you were dicks before this. 
[143]Seriously. Now you do have something in your teeth. 
[144]Yippee. 
[145]That was a lot of... what's the word... syllables. Are you saying I'm better? 
[146]My Mom used to call me that. Me and Jesus. Thank you. I owe you my life. 
[147]You f-fucking sadistic- 
[148]What have you done to me?! 
[149]You... sadistic... fuck! 
[150]Then time to make me me again. 
[151]Fuck! 
[152]Ow. 
[153]No... no way! I'm not making her life as ugly as mine! 
[154]Wrong. I'm a monster, inside and out. I belong in a circus, the kind that rolls around Eastern Europe in covered wagons. 
[155]And the only guy who can fix this fugly mug, the asshole who ran that mutant factory, escaped to who knows where. 
[156]Find Francis-Go-Fuck-Himself. 
[157]I'm gonna work my way through his crew... crushing bad guys' skulls, `til one of `em leads me to Francis. Then I'll force him to cure this face. Stomp his bloody guts into a fine vintage. And win Vanessa back. 
[158]So what do you suggest?     A mask? 
[159]Like a testicle with teeth. 
[160]What? 
[161]Deadpool. Deadpool    Final Shooting Script   11/16/15
dialogues.VANESSA:
[1]Whoa, whoa... 
[2]Sure you wanna shoot your whole wad? 
[3]Vanessa. 
[4]Say the magic words, Fat Gandalf. 
[5]And you- Hands off the merchandise. 
[6]Yup. 
[7]Rougher than yours.     Daddy left before I was born. 
[8]Ever had a cigarette put out on your skin? 
[9]I was molested. 
[10]Uncles.     They took turns. 
[11]Bedroom?    Lucky. I slept in a dishwasher box. 
[12]Who would do such a thing? 
[13]About forty-eight minutes of whatever you want... And a low-fat dessert. 
[14]I get it. You love skeeball.          Apparently more than you love vagina. 
[15]Thank you, son. You know how to make a woman feel special. 
[16]Balls in holes. 
[17]Bring it, big man. 
[18]Ruh-roh. 
[19]And the... pencil eraser. 
[20]Unfortunately, my anus-loving friend, your forty-eight minutes are up. 
[21]Five mini lion-bots?! Three minutes. 
[22]Cuddle? 
[23]How long can you keep this up? 
[24]Happy Valentine's Day... 
[25]Year of the Dog. 
[26]Relax... Happy International Women's Day... 
[27]Happy Yom Kippur... Happy Cesar Chavez Day... Happy Lent... Happy Lyme Disease Awareness Day... Happy Wednesday... 
[28]Oo... ow... 
[29]Happy Thanksgiving. Happy Wednesday. 
[30]Y'know, red's your color. Brings out the bloodshot in your eyes. Christmas gift! Catch! 
[31]Limited edition. I had to give the kid behind the counter a rub and tug. I'm kidding. I'm not kidding. I'm kidding. It was nearly five full months of Skeeball. 
[32]Really. 
[33]Why's that? 
[34]Hey, I've been meaning to ask you, only `cause you haven't gotten around to asking me- Wade, will you- 
[35]Uhh... jinx? 
[36]You're not wearing pants. Where exactly were you hiding that? 
[37]You mean-? 
[38]That's my line. I love you, Wade Wilson. 
[39]I did.    At my old job. 
[40]Easy.    I can take it back. 
[41]Just rode a bitch's back, like Yoda on Luke? 
[42]`Empire.' 
[43]So what do we do? Surely there's something... we can... do. I mean, my uncle, he was diagnosed with thyroid cancer, and there was this new experimental drug that- 
[44]Wham? 
[45]So I'm s'posed to just... smile and wave you out the door? 
[46]Bernadette's not going anywhere. `Cause you're not going anywhere. 
[47]You know what I mean. You belong here at home. Surrounded by your Voltron... and your Bernadette... and your me. 
[48]Well, I want to remember us us. We we? 
[49]Are you gonna keep saying it like that? Look, I get this impulse. I do. 
[50]Before I met you, I used to fantasize about dying alone in the woods, torn apart by wolves. 
[51]But that was then, and this is now. Walk out that door. I dare you. I will ride you out. And I won't let go. Yoda on Luke. 
[52]If you're willing to fight. There are still options. We'll find them. Together. 
[53]No one's boom-boxing shit. 
[54]What do we we have to lose? 
[55]Very hilly. 
[56]`Final' because this is where we find the cure. 
[57]I knew it was you. 
[58]With the weird, curvy edges. 
[59]Like a jigsaw puzzle. 
[60]Says the sanity-challenged killer mutant in parachute pants. P.S. I've never played the role of damsel in distress. 
[61]Wade? 
[62]But you did, asshole. 
[63]If we survive this.   I'm gonna kill you. 
[64]Gratuitous. Worth it. 
[65]Start talking. 
[66]Rough? 
[67]So you live in a house! 
[68]You mean this mask? 
[69]You mean like this? 
[70]Sure I'm sure. 
[71]Ew. 
[72]Kidding! Get over yourself!        I'd hit that shit. 
[73]After a brief adjustment period and one or two drinks. It's a face... I'd be happy to sit on.
dialogues.AJAX:
[1]They won't disappoint. 
[2]There won't be one. Demand is high. You aren't the only one with a war to win. 
[3]There's been a small... disruption in our supply chain. We'll deliver in full the following month. Say, ten percent off for the inconvenience? 
[4]We appreciate your business. 
[5]Actually, I do. 
[6]Patience, Angel. All in good time. 
[7]You're a talker. 
[8]Mr. Wilson, my name is Ajax. I manage the Workshop. My `welcome' speech used to be full of euphemisms like `You may feel some discomfort.' But I've grown blunt. 
[9]The Workshop is not a government program. It's a private institution tasked with turning reclamation projects like yourself into men of extraordinary abilities. I'm about to remake your life. But if you think cancer cures painlessly, you're wrong. If you think super-human powers are acquired painlessly, you're wrong. 
[10]We're injecting you with a serum that activates mutant genes. For it to work, we need to subject you to extreme stress. 
[11]You've heard the whole make-an-omelette, break-some-eggs bit? I'm about to hurt you, Wade. The kind of hurt I can't describe and you can't prepare for. It's cruel stuff. And there's no way out for you. No secret you can tell me. No soft spot in me to appeal to. 
[12]One more thing. What's the ad? `I'm not just the president. I'm a client?' I've been through this procedure myself. It made me stronger. It also scorched my nerve endings. So I no longer feel pain. In fact... I no longer feel anything. 
[13]Joke away. The one thing that never survives this place is a sense of humor. 
[14]All yours. 
[15]The serum I'm injecting you with targets any mutant genes lurking in your DNA. 
[16]Adrenaline acts as a catalyst for the serum, so we must subject you to extreme stress. 
[17]If you're lucky, the mutant genes will activate and manifest in spectacular fashion. 
[18]If not, we'll have no choice but to keep hurting you in new and different ways. Each more painful than the last. 
[19]Until you finally mutate.      Or die. 
[20]With the mouse ears? Creative, and delicious. 
[21]It's OK, I encourage distractions. Can't have you giving up on us, can we now, you little worm? 
[22]You are so relentlessly annoying. Shut the fuck up, or I'll sew that pretty mouth shut. 
[23]Is that what you think? 
[24]Seems your genes are as stubborn as you. But we can still increase your suffering. We don't even have a name for this next toy. 
[25]We reduce the oxygen in the air to the exact point you feel like you're suffocating. 
[26]If you start to pass out, and your brain waves slow, we turn up the O2. If you catch your breath, and your heart rate slows, we turn it back down. And we leave you. Right. There. 
[27]Waterboarding is the most severe stress known to man. This device prolongs that stress. For hours, days, weeks... 
[28]The saddest part? You still think we're making you a super-hero. You. Dishonorable discharge. Beating up pizza guys. Hip deep in hookers. You're nothing. I'd call you an asshole, but I'd have to answer to assholes. Little secret, Wade. The Workshop doesn't make super-heroes. It makes super-slaves. We're gonna fit you for a control collar and auction you to the highest bidder. Who knows what they'll force you to do. Put down freedom fighters. Murder innocents. Or maybe just mow a lawn or two. 
[29]Enjoy the weekend! Deadpool   Final Shooting Script   11/16/15 
[30]The `Punch-Bowl!' 
[31]Oo. Someone lost his shot at homecoming king. 
[32]No. Not fair. Everything I've done to you has been in your best interest. Even this next bit. You may be cured, but you still need to learn to be a better man. Polite. Respectful. What better way to teach you than to close this lid... and keep torturing you stupid. 
[33]Either I kill him, or he kills me.     Let's put him out of our misery... 
[34]Bloody hell. Someone lost his shot at homecoming king. 
[35]You give me too much credit. This... this is the result of your genes. 
[36]The punch bowl merely raised your stress to trigger the mutation. 
[37]Where's the gratitude?! You're cured! Your mutated cells can heal anything. They're attacking the cancer as fast as it can form. Your insides are a war zone. Not to mention your outsides! 
[38]I've seen similar side-effects before.         I could cure them for you. But really, where's the fun in that? 
[39]I'm going to close this lid again.     Maybe you no longer need it. But I do. 
[40]He's all yours. 
[41]Whoa. 
[42]Hey, hey, alright. It's alright. I think he earned that one, yeah? You take off. Go on... off you go. 
[43]One question. What's my name? 
[44]Didn't think so. 
[45]You can't kill me, Wade. I'm the only one who can fix that ugly mug. 
[46]Say it.     `Francis.' 
[47]Quit showing off, Angel. 
[48]Wade Fucking Wilson. 
[49]I suppose if I looked like him, I'd wear a mask too. Only wish I mended the same. 
[50]Not to worry. We'll put him out of our misery. On our terms. 
[51]He can't - if there's nothing left of him to heal. And then we go back to business as usual. 
[52]What say we leave the matches at home? 
[53]You have Wade Wilson to thank for this. 
[54]`The good Lord sends the fishing... 
[55]...but you must dig the bait.' 
[56]That's what I thought, but he keeps on coming back. Like a Bad Jesus. But despite all Wade's powers, I still hold the advantage: He feels. Too strongly for his own good. Let's see how he fights with your head on the block. 
[57]How does it feel? Ex-boyfriend abandons you, becomes a sanity-challenged killer mutant in tights... 
[58]`Til now. 
[59]That never gets old.    But neither will you. 
[60]What better way to climb back in your head... 
[61]You two have a lot to work out. Take a deep breath. Wait. Wrong choice... 
[62]...of words. 
[63]I hear you grow back parts. When I get done... parts will have to grow back you. 
[64]Fine.   Fists. 
[65]Sorry. It's just. All this time, you bought that I have the cure? I'm flattered. But do I really look like the scientist type? You want the guy behind the guy. His name's Dr. Killebrew. And he's long gone. Who knows where. 
[66]You heard me. 
[67]Sounds even stupider when you say it.
dialogues.WEASEL:
[1]Wade Wilson, Patron Saint of the Pitiful. What can I get you? 
[2]We got that in common. 
[3]Orlofsky. For a merc, you sure are warm- blooded. Bet you let the boy off easy- peasy, too. 
[4]And killing them. I've seen your Instagram. What was Special Forces doing in Jacksonville, anyway? 
[5]Kahlua, Bailey's, whip cream.        Fellatio in a glass. 
[6]Remind me what good comes of this? 
[7]Still kicking. 
[8]Um.    See.    About that- 
[9]Wait, who did you pick? 
[10]Jesus. Someone needs a blow-job and a shower. Though courtesy calls for the latter first. 
[11]Fresh out of Patron. Wheatgrass? 
[12]This belongs on the wall. I want to remember you when you looked... alive. 
[13]Almost forgot... 
[14]Guy came in asking for you.     Real Grim Reaper type. 
[15]I don't know? May further the plot? 
[16]C'mon, you can't look that bad! It's like that blemish no one notices but you. 
[17]I can't envision a scenario where Vanessa won't take you ba- -aaaaaccckkk!! Holy shit. You... are... terrifying. You look like an avocado had sex with an older avocado. 
[18]We might have to move our relationship to text and phone only. 
[19]I take back the Vanessa thing.      You have only one option. 
[20]Star in low budget horror movies. Seriously, you look like Freddy Krueger face-fucked a topographical map of Utah. 
[21]OK. Not exactly the plot of Beauty and the Beast, but cool. Good news, that douche thinks you're dead. Advantage you. He won't think you're coming. Bad news, with a puss like that, you'll be spotted fast. 
[22]Not a bad idea! You... are... haunting. Your face is the stuff of nightmares. 
[23]How `bout a super-suit? And a nickname! Bitter-Boy. Super-Fist. Captain Never- Die. 
[24]Nothing. It's just... you know, I just realized, I'm never winning the- 
[25]Deadpool.    To you, Mr. Pool. 
[26]Wade, we got a problem.    And by we I mean you. 
[27]Afurious? Wait, is it Monday?! They have an amazing Matzah Ball Soup Monday. Never mind. Have you figured what you're gonna tell her? 
[28]It's a start. 
[29]Or as I like to call her, Irony! 
[30]How do you even know she's here? 
[31]Manager said she went that way. Good luck, Tiger! 
[32]That's about... three thousand shells. 
[33]She cool? 
[34]That's the shit emoji. A turd with a smile, see? How did Google ever approve that?
dialogues.BLIND AL:
[1]Ass-hat. 
[2]Yes. I'm old. I wear pants. 
[3]Upside of being blind:     I've never seen you in Crocs. 
[4]Yes I know. Downside of being blind:        I hear everything in this duplex. 
[5]Too much naughty, too little nice. 
[6]Bactine? 
[7]You're telling me. I don't mind the Kullen. It's an improvement on the Hurdal. 
[8]Screw please. 
[9]You'd be surprised. 
[10]Ta.    Dah. 
[11]I wish I'd never heard of Craig's List. 
[12]Why such a douche this morning? 
[13]I'm gonna find this `Craig.'        And I'm gonna kill him. 
[14]Seltzer water and lemon for blood. Or wear red. 
[15]I hope you're doing us the courtesy of pants. 
[16]Tylenol P.M.? 
[17]Am I crazy, or is your hand really small? 
[18]Eesh. I get why you're so pissy. But your mood's never gonna brighten `til you find this woman you love and tell her how you feel! 
[19]Love is blind, Wade. 
[20]What was that? 
[21]So you're just gonna lie there and whimper? 
[22]I was gonna spend tonight assembling the Borgsjo, but this is holding my interest. 
[23]Shit. 
[24]That's every piece in the house. 
[25]It was him or me. I did hit it, right? 
[26]Fuck you.
dialogues.DOPINDER:
[1]Why the fancy red suit, Mr. Pool? 
[2]Smells good, no? 
[3]Ah yes. Gita. She is quite lovely. She was supposed to make me a very agreeable wife. Mom and Dad chose her rather excellently. But Gita's heart has been stolen by my cousin Bandhu. Bandhu is as dishonorable as he is attractive. 
[4]Because you hailed it? 
[5]And how does Ms. Mama June taste? 
[6]Shall we turn back? 
[7]My card.    That's $27.50. 
[8]Be sure to... ask for me again? 
[9]And a convivial... Tuesday in April to you, Pool... Guy. 
[10]Where do you want to be going! 
[11]I tried to hold on tight, Mr. Pool. But Bandhu is more craftier - and handsomer - than me. 
[12]I cannot be stopping. 
[13]She indeed has ESPN!    I am quite uninsuranced. 
[14]Who brought this twinkly man? 
[15]Oh, that?      That was Bandhu. 
[16]My romantic rival, Bandhu. He's tied up in the trunk. I'm doing as you said, D.P. I plan to gut him like a tandoori fish. Then dump his lifeless corpse on Gita's doorstep like a cat with a dead bird. Mom and Dad will be over the moon. 
[17]Fine, fine. Safe and gentle-like.          Here we are... 
[18]I too am clairvoyance. I presume a crisp high five? 
[19]Knock em dead, Pool Boy. 
[20]Bandhu?
dialogues.COLOSSUS:
[1]I've given Deadpool every chance to join us. And what is my reward? More immaturity and criminality! When will he finally grow up and see benefits of becoming X-Man? 
[2]But I thought you were at top of class. 
[3]You ate breakfast, yes? Breakfast is most important meal of day. Here. Protein bar, good for bones. Deadpool may try to break yours. 
[4]Is that you, Wade?! I knew you'd see error of ways! 
[5]Stop the car. I must leave a note. 
[6]It's not a boy band. 
[7]Bandwho? 
[8]I'd prefer not to hit a woman. So please place your hands behind your- 
[9]Language.    Please. 
[10]Uh... you seem to have, um... 
[11]You're OK.     Take it slow. 
[12]Wade! 
[13]Four or five moments. 
[14]Four or five moments.      That's all it takes... 
[15]Be a hero. Everyone thinks it's a full time job. Wake up a hero. Brush your teeth a hero. Go to work a hero. Not true. Over a lifetime, there are only four or five moments that really matter. Moments when you're offered a choice. To make a sacrifice. Conquer a flaw. Save a friend. Spare an enemy. 
[16]In those moments, everything else falls away. The way the world sees us. The way we see oursel- 
[17]Huuugglh! Why! 
[18]Just promise-
dialogues.DOCTOR:
[1]People react to news of late-stage cancer differently. 
[2]Mr. Wilson? 
[3]Mr. Wilson? 
[4]Take your time to process this. 
[5]Buenos días, Señor Abe. 
[6]Voy a llegar dentro de tu cuerpo. 
[7]De que se cure! Señor Abe, you are cured. 
[8]¡Proximo! Next! 
[9]So sorry, you surprise me. How... long... you standing there, Señor? 
[10]Mr. Wilson... these results are remarkable. 
[11]Your cancer cells are more aggressive than ever. Dividing and metastasizing at a fantastic rate. 
[12]But... the cells have inalterably changed. They're no longer destructive, but productive, selectively targeting and replacing damaged tissue. 
[13]Better than better.    A miracle. 
[14]There. There. Your journey's been long and difficult. But you've become something extraordinary. Just rest now. Rest.
dialogues.ANGEL DUST:
[1]You'd like that, huh.    Welcome to our little hospital. 
[2]Shut.   The fuck. Up. 
[3]What, you expected Weapon X? 
[4]Or if you keep yapping, years... 
[5]There's a brave face. 
[6]He looks like a turd in a punch-bowl. 
[7]Better to be the hunter than the hunted. 
[8]For your flight. 
[9]Makes perfect sense. 
[10]And if he heals? 
[11]No one fires! 
[12]They're mine. 
[13]Never mind. Fire. 
[14]C'mere, ya little bitch.
dialogues.RECRUITER:
[1]Mr. Wilson. Have a seat. I understand you've recently been diagnosed with terminal cancer. 
[2]It's my job. Recruitment. And you have quite a reputation. I'm sorry you've had a tough go. But you're a fighter. And not just for Johnny Canuck, impressive as your stint in special forces was. Forty- one confirmed kills? 
[3]Now you spend your days sticking up for the little man, slitting small time throats for small time folks. 
[4]Speaking of which... Mr. Wilson, I represent an organization that may be able to help. What if I told you we can cure your cancer? And what's more, give you abilities most men only dream of? 
[5]The world needs extraordinary men. We won't just make you better. We'll make you better than better. A super-hero. 
[6]Mr. Wilson! Nothing warms my heart like a change of someone else's. 
[7]You finally hit `fuck-it.' 
[8]Of course. 
[9]I hope you enjoy your stay. 
[10]To whom should I address my... desperate bargaining? 
[11]Mr... Wilson? 
[12]And I pride myself on being persuasive.
dialogues.NEGASONIC TEENAGE WARHEAD:
[1]Wait, I'm getting a premonition. 
[2]He's uninsured. 
[3]-called that yourself? 
[4]Wait!   Where's your duffel bag? 
[5]Hey! 
[6]Climb on. 
[7]1975 called. 
[8]It wants its peep show back. 
[9]It's alright. You're cool. 
[10]There's the stupid.
dialogues.JEREMY:
[1]This 7348 Red Ledge Drive? And you're... Mr. Merchant? 
[2]Then who placed the call? 
[3]God I hope not. Words cannot express- 
[4]Uh. Sir? Before you do anything to him. Could I have a big tip? 
[5]Yeah. 
[6]That's unfortunately me. 
[7]B-but I'm- 
[8]Y-yeah. 
[9]W-we are?
dialogues.MERCHANT:
[1]Will it help if I slow down?         I didn't. Order. The pizza. 
[2]The Mr. Merchant who didn't.         Order. The. Fucking. Pie. 
[3]The fuck are you? And what are you doing in my crib?! 
[4]This is about the poker game, right? I told Howie... Listen, take whatever you want! 
[5]Dodged a big time bullet on that o- 
[6]Can I at least have my Sam's Club card baaa- 
[7]I don't have a cat!
dialogues.CUNNINGHAM:
[1]Puppies. 
[2]It helps picturing puppies. 
[3]Or kittens. If you swing that way. 
[4]A bucket list? 
[5]Finishing my Lego Millenium Falcon... 
[6]Making my kids banana pancakes... 
[7]Wade!   Help! Wade!
dialogues.NTW:
[1]Like... The house that blows up every few years? The fashion-forward jump-suits? I need to get myself kicked out of X- School. 
[2]Was that sarcasm?    Awesome. 
[3]Deadfool. 
[4]You guys going for a bite?      Early bird special? 
[5]Colossus! 
[6]Now if you'll excuse me. I'm just a boy... about to stand in front of a girl... and tell her- what the fuck am I gonna tell her?!
